snippet: A day after winning a highly coveted Security Council seat, Saudi Arabia angrily cited the body’s response to Syria and Iran in turning it down.
abstract: Saudi Arabia rejects highly coveted seat on United Nations Security Council, to shock of many; decision underscores depth of Saudi anger over what monarchy sees as weak and conciliatory Western stances toward Syria and Iran, Saudi Arabia's regional rival.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York, Alan Cowell from London, and Ben Hubbard from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: A day after winning a highly coveted Security Council seat, Saudi Arabia angrily cited the body’s response to Syria and Iran in turning it down.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia Rejects U.N. Security Council Seat in Protest Move
headline.print_headline: Saudi Arabia Rejects U.N. Security Council Seat in Protest Move
